|Title=Radiography of the spine
|Description=How to recognise a syndesmophyte
|Rubric=Multimedia content
|Contributors=
|Order=10}}

[[File:Front radiograph of the lumbar spine with syndesmophytosis.jpg|vignette|Front radiograph of the lumbar spine with syndesmophytosis]]
[[File:Radiographie de profil du rachis lombaire.jpg|vignette|Radiographie du rachis lombaire avec syndesmophytose]]Syndesmophytes are thin, vertical bony structures between two vertebrae.

question.question: What is the primary characteristic of a syndesmophyte?
question.option_b: A thin, vertical bony structure between two vertebrae
question.option_c: A long, thin bony process extending from one vertebra to the next
